p: Serratia oryzae and Exiguobacterium profundum were identified as the most abundant bacteria in the An. stephensi mysorensis. The predominant gut bacteria in the An. stephensi intermediate were Acinetobacter junii and Bacillus pumilus. Over 1400 bp of the 16S rDNA sequences of the identified bacteria were successfully sequenced and deposited in the GenBank with the accession numbers MN197761-64. These representative bacteria were used individually or in combination to investigate the inhibitory effects of PREO formulations.
